subject: Re: [junit] How to solve TransformerFactoryConfigurationError
msgSnippet: ... It looks like Xalan is not on your classpath. You can learn about Xalan here (http://xml.apache.org/xalan-j/), and download it if you need it. When running
messageBody:
g d wrote:
>
> Hi Friends,
>
> I have a problem when executing ant.
> The Error is
> javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactoryConfigurationError: Provider
> org.apache.xalan.processor.TransformerFactoryImpl not found

It looks like Xalan is not on your classpath. You can learn about Xalan
here (http://xml.apache.org/xalan-j/), and download it if you need it.

When running Ant, use the -debug and -verbose command line switches to
get information about what's on the classpath. If something is missing,
then you need to fix your classpath. Without more information about your
environment, I can't be more specific.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
